SoilHydro 0.1.0

Predict \(\theta(h)\) for new suctions (kPa or hPa)

vg_predict.Rd

Generates predictions from fitted VG parameters at user-supplied suctions expressed in either kPa or hPa.

vg_predict(
  params_df,
  id_col = NULL,
  new_h,
  units = c("kPa", "hPa"),
  filter_id = NULL
)

Arguments

params_df

Output of vg_fit_optim.

id_col

Name of the ID column in params_df. Defaults to the first column.

new_h

Numeric vector of new suctions.

units

Units of new_h, either "kPa" or "hPa".

filter_id

Optional scalar to return predictions only for a single ID.

Value

data.frame with columns ID, h, units, theta.

Examples

# Using 'fits' from the vg_fit_optim() example:
# Predict theta at custom suctions (kPa) for all IDs:
new_grid <- c(0.5, 5, 50, 500, 1500)
pred_all <- vg_predict(fits, id_col = "ID", new_h = new_grid, units = "kPa")
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
head(pred_all)
#> Error: object 'pred_all' not found

# Predict only for a single ID:
pred_A <- vg_predict(fits, id_col = "ID", new_h = new_grid, units = "kPa", filter_id = "A")
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
pred_A
#> Error: object 'pred_A' not found

# If your target grid is in hPa, set units = "hPa":
new_hPa <- c(10, 100, 1000, 10000)  # equals 1, 10, 100, 1000 kPa
pred_hPa <- vg_predict(fits, id_col = "ID", new_h = new_hPa, units = "hPa")
#> Error: object 'fits' not found
head(pred_hPa)
#> Error: object 'pred_hPa' not found
